title: The top 5 games of the year
summary: These are the games that have received the most praise from gamers and critics alike. They're not only fun and interesting to play, but they also have great stories and unique gameplay elements. The Last of Us Part 2 is a sequel to the 2013 smash hit “The Last Of Us” and is a single-player game played from a third-person perspective. PlayerUnknown’s Battlegrounds is a fight to the death between 100 players and the goal of the game is to be the last man standing.

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Games are a major part of our lives. We spend lots of time playing them, talking about them with friends and family, thinking about them and even dreaming about them. The games we play also reflect who we are as individuals. They serve as a mirror that reflects back an image of our unique personalities. Each one of us has different preferences and taste in games. There\u2019s also a lot to choose from, too: There are so many video games today that no individual can ever hope to try them all. That said, there are some great ones out there and they come in all shapes and sizes: Action-adventure, shooters, RPGs; you name it! Here is a list of the top 5 games this year that you must play if you haven\u2019t already:"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"5. Horizon Zero Dawn"),mdx("p",null,"This is one of the only games that lets you play as a badass female lead. It received many praises for its interesting storyline and gameplay, which was inspired by the \u201CThe End of the World\u201D genre. The story takes place in the future and the world is left in ruins by a mysterious machine life form. The humans have been reduced to tribal civilizations living in primitive conditions, while the machines have developed intelligence and are now waging a war against them. Horizon Zero Dawn follows Aloy, a young outcast of a tribal society, who discovers that she\u2019s connected to the machines and is able to destroy them with special arrows. The game is played from a third-person perspective and it\u2019s open-world, which means you can roam freely within the map."),mdx("h2",null,"4. Person 5."),mdx("p",null,"This game is all about your decisions. In fact, they\u2019re the only things that matter in this game. You play as a character named Jax who is a prisoner on a spaceship. The entire game lasts for only 17 minutes and revolves around you trying to escape the ship by hacking into its computer. You can either try to escape by yourself or help a fellow prisoner, nicknamed \u201CEight\u201D, who is also on the ship. The game ends differently and you are given four different outcomes based on what your choice is. It\u2019s a simple game, but one that\u2019s definitely worth checking out for all the hype it had."),mdx("h2",null,"3. nier: automata"),mdx("p",null,"This game has a very interesting story behind it. It was actually a sequel to a game that came out in 2010. Despite the fact that the majority of people didn\u2019t even know about the 2010 game, the sequel was a smash hit. It\u2019s a single-player game and played from a third-person perspective. It revolves around an android army that is fighting an interplanetary war against humanity. You\u2019re an android that has been sent to Earth to find out more about why the army is fighting. The game has a grimdark story and is often described as an RPG with strong elements of the \u201Cshooter\u201D genre."),mdx("h2",null,"2. PlayerUnknown\u2019s Battlegrounds"),mdx("p",null,"This game is the ultimate test of survival. The gameplay is basically a fight to the death between 100 players and it\u2019s played from a first-person perspective. The goal of the game is to be the last man standing. You start off with nothing and have to find weapons, armor and other items to survive. The map is also filled with items that can help you, but only if you find them first. The game is played online with other real-life players, so you need to stay on your toes to survive the other players who are out to get you."),mdx("h2",null,"1. The Last of Us Part 2"),mdx("p",null,"This game is a sequel to the 2013 smash hit \u201CThe Last of Us\u201D, which is widely considered to be one of the greatest games ever made. It\u2019s an action-adventure survival horror played from a third-person perspective. It takes place in a post-apocalyptic world that was ravaged by a fungal pandemic. Joel and Ellie, the main characters of the first game, are back for more action. The game is set several years after the events of the first game and has received critical acclaim from critics and gamers alike."),mdx("h2",null,"Conclusion"),mdx("p",null,"The list of games that we\u2019ve compiled here represents the best of the best. These are the games that have received the most praise from gamers and critics alike. They\u2019re not only fun and interesting to play, but they also have great stories and unique gameplay elements. They\u2019ve been made with great care to detail and are definitely worth checking out."),mdx("p",null,"With so many great games to choose from, it can be tricky to figure out which ones to play first. Ideally, you should try to play as many of these games as you can and try out different genres, too. That way, you won\u2019t just be playing the same game over and over again."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best and Worst Games of the Year

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`It takes a lot of great games to make a great year. In 2018, we saw new entries in long-running series like Red Dead Redemption, Assassin\u2019s Creed, and Halo as well as brand new IP such as Monster Hunter: World, Into the Breach, and A Way Out. It was a year that saw game developers pushed by streaming services like Twitch and YouTube continue to experiment with new ideas and designs while also returning to their roots with older properties.
That being said, not all games are created equal. There are excellent games and then there are... others less so. To help you sort through the deluge of new releases this year, Gamers Central has compiled a list of our top ten favorite titles coupled with an even longer list of disappointments that you may want to avoid entirely or at least wait for a sale before picking up.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Solitaire Players

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`There are a million and one ways to play solitaire. The rules may be simple, but there is actually so much strategy involved that it\u2019s almost like learning a whole new game every time you sit down to play. If you enjoy playing solitaire games as much as we do, then you\u2019ll probably also agree that there are a lot of different variations of the game itself as well. Some versions of solitaire require skill, luck, and a little bit of patience all at once.
These top rated games are some of the most fun and engaging ways to play this classic card game. Whether you prefer an easy version with higher rewards or something more strategic and challenging, these solitaire games will keep your interest from start to finish!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`If you\u2019re interested in video games, you have probably heard that 2018 was a great year for gaming. It was. But it wasn\u2019t just this past year\u2014gaming has been on the upswing for a while now. There are more gamers playing more games than ever before, and it\u2019s an exciting time to be part of this culture.
There are so many excellent video games released every month that it can be overwhelming to keep track of them all. That\u2019s why we\u2019ve compiled a list of what we think are the best new games from the last few months of 2018 that everyone should play if they get the opportunity:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Worst Games of the Year

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The video game industry is filled with great games. These are also some of the most challenging and difficult ones to make. Cracking the code on how to build a well-crafted and engaging video game requires practice, ingenuity, skill, and patience. But not every developer is up to the task. Some simply fail at creating an entertaining experience for players. This list compiles some of the disappointments from 2018 that failed to meet an acceptable standard of quality.
These are the worst games of 2018, broken down by category and listed in no particular order. Some might have had good intentions or interesting concepts, but fell short in their execution. If you\u2019re looking for something new to play this year, stay away from these titles as they won\u2019t give you your money\u2019s worth or much satisfaction beyond finishing them once (if that).`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Best Games of the Year for Partygoers
The Best Games of the Year for Couples

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`It\u2019s the most wonderful time of the year. From binge-watching Christmas TV specials to baking gingerbread cookies and sipping hot cocoa, there are plenty of ways to get into the holiday spirit. And what better way to keep that good cheer going than by playing a game with your significant other?
With so many different board games available on the market, it can be challenging to figure out which ones are worth investing in. Thankfully, this list features some of the best games perfect for couples this holiday season. Whether you\u2019re looking for a light-hearted romp or an intense challenge that brings you closer as partners, these games have you covered.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
